revised_title: Relative Retardation of Light Components Through Crystalline Plates
tldr: This article discusses the relative retardation between the components of a light stream when passing through a crystalline plate. The author presents a method to calculate the retardation, which can be extended to any order, and explains the relationship between corresponding terms in the equation and the roots of a biquadratic equation. The findings have implications for understanding light behavior in biaxal crystals.
